intro: Tofieldia racemosa var. glutinosa, commonly known as sticky tofieldia, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Xerophyllum, which includes other species of flowering plants adapted to dry environments. The plant features grass-like leaves and produces tall, dense spikes of white to pale blue flowers. Its unique characteristic is the sticky, resinous substance found on its stems and leaves, which gives it its common name. This plant thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in open woodlands and rocky areas.
